description: This course offers students an integrated approach of theory, policy, and enterprise to understand international trade and investment. The course focuses on the costs and benefits of global economic interdependence for students who plan to enter an international business career or to work for government and international organizations in activities affected by international economic relations. Offered annually. Prerequisites: ECON 261 and ECON 262, and one of ECON 260 or ECON 263 or SDS 272, or permission of instructor.
name: International Econ
notes: Open to juniors and seniors only
Counts toward Quantitative Research requirement for Quantitative Economics major
prerequisites: Prerequisites: ECON 261 and ECON 262, and one of ECON 260 or ECON 263 or SDS 272, or permission of instructor.
title: International Economics
